sources.title: Murders in the Rue Morgue (1932)
sources.description: "Murders in the Rue Morgue" is a horror film directed by Robert Florey , loosely based on Edgar Allan Poe's short story of the same name. The film stars Bela Lugosi as the sinister Dr. Mirakle, who conducts twisted experiments in 19th-century Paris.  Dr. Mirakle, a deranged scientist, is obsessed with proving that humans and apes are biologically related. To do this, he abducts young women, injecting them with blood from his pet gorilla, Erik , in hopes of creating a hybrid. His experiments fail, leading to the deaths of many of his victims. The story unfolds through the eyes of Pierre Dupin , a medical student who becomes embroiled in the sinister happenings. He is in love with Camille L'Espanaye , who becomes one of Mirakle's targets. The plot thickens as Pierre and Camille, along with their friends, visit Mirakle’s carnival sideshow, where his horrific practices begin to reveal themselves. After Camille is kidnapped by Mirakle, Pierre desperately seeks help from the police, trying to convince them of the scientist's malevolent actions. As the story progresses, a series of gruesome murders points to Mirakle's involvement. In the climax, a confrontation occurs between Pierre and Mirakle. Erik, the gorilla, ultimately turns against his master, leading to a chaotic showdown. Pierre manages to rescue Camille but is forced to face the tragic consequences of Mirakle's experiments.

sources.title: The Murders in the Rue Morgue | FULL MOVIE starring Val Kilmer | Classic Crime Thriller
sources.description:
Poe's classic chiller of inhuman crime, shrill suspense and dazzling detective work in Paris at the turn of the 19th Century. Starring Val Kilmer and Ian McShane ("Deadwood").

sources.title: Murders in the Rue Morgue - Trailer

metadata.Plot: In 19th Century Paris, the maniacal Dr. Mirakle abducts young women and injects them with ape blood in an attempt to prove ape-human kinship. He constantly meets failure as the abducted women die. Medical student Pierre Dupin discovers what Mirakle is doing too late to prevent the abduction of his girlfriend Camille. Now he desperately tries to enlist the help of the police to get her back.
metadata.Writer: Edgar Allan Poe, Robert Florey, Tom Reed
metadata.Actors: Bela Lugosi, Sidney Fox, Leon Ames
